definition: just before the battle/to approach the front line
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet

sentences.english: The soldiers were punished for their base conduct in running away from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵由于临阵脱逃的可耻行为受到惩罚。

sentences.english: Freddy chickened out of the plan at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷迪临阵脱逃，最终退出了这个计划。

sentences.english: He's boning up for his finals.
sentences.chinese: 他为应付期末考试而临阵磨枪。

sentences.english: I have to cram for finals next week. ;
sentences.chinese: 我必须临阵磨枪以准备下周的期末考试。

sentences.english: I spent the last 48 hours cramming for it.
sentences.chinese: 我在刚过去的48小时在临阵磨枪。

sentences.english: I have years of experience in battlefield combat, which makes me competent for the principalship .
sentences.chinese: 我拥有多年临阵作战的经验，足以胜任这个职务。

sentences.english: I have to cram all night for tomorrow's exams.
sentences.chinese: 为了明天的考试，我得熬夜临阵磨枪。

sentences.english: Claire canceled the wedding. She got cold feet.
sentences.chinese: 克莱儿取消婚礼，她临阵退缩。

sentences.english: He let the opportunity slip and fled the field.
sentences.chinese: 他错过了机会，而且临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: He was accused of running away when the enemy attacked.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控在敌人进攻时临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: The band couldn't perform because the singer chickened out backstage. (chicken out)
sentences.chinese: 这个乐团不能表演，因为主唱在后台临阵退缩了。

sentences.english: Never swap horses while crossing the stream.
sentences.chinese: 过河莫换马，临阵勿换将。

sentences.english: Put him in a designed crisis to see if he will escape or change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 设计一个危机的状况，看他会不会临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: Henry wanted to ask Sue on a date, but then he chickened out.
sentences.chinese: 亨利想约苏出去，但是他后来却临阵脱逃。

sentences.english: Several white-livered fellows ran away at the beginning of the battle.
sentences.chinese: 战斗一开始，几个胆小鬼就临阵脱逃。

definition: just before the contest/on the eve of war
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
commander-in-chief (military)/star player (sports)/key figure (in an organization)
to underestimate the enemy
to attack the enemy
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to lead troops
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
talented field commander (military)
to fight with all one's might
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
command/commander-in-chief
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
veteran general
